author: Leslie Scism
title: MetLife Pegs Number of Workers Missing Benefits at 13,500
text:
MetLife Inc. said roughly 13,500 workers were left without their monthly retirement benefits over the past quarter century because of a records mistake, the first time the insurance giant disclosed the specific number of people affected by the pension snafu.
In a regulatory filing Tuesday, MetLife attributed the problems to a policy established 25 years ago to contact would-be pension recipients twice. This was rather than employing aggressive search techniques to track down people and make them aware of their eligibility...
